## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I'm interested in creating my own blockchain on Verus. What is the minimum number of public nodes required to start a chain?

**AI Assistant:**
The minimum number of public nodes required to start a chain is 2. You need to provide two public nodes to start your chain. Do you have any other questions about setting up your own blockchain?

**User:**
That's good to know. Is it possible to launch a blockchain without manual intervention?

**AI Assistant:**
Currently, manual intervention is required to provide initial nodes to start a chain. However, this step will be automated soon, eliminating the need for manual intervention. We're working hard to make it easier for users to launch their own blockchains!

**User:**
Okay, that makes sense. How many confirmations are required for your chain to be visible to everyone on the test-net?

**AI Assistant:**
Only one confirmation is required for your chain to be visible to everyone on the test-net. Once the transaction that created your chain gets one confirmation, it will be visible on the discover page or can be searched for on the connect page. It's pretty straightforward!

**User:**
I've also heard that I can mine and stake other coins on Verus. Is that true? Can I only mine and stake my own project?

**AI Assistant:**
No, you can mine and stake up to 14 other coins in addition to your own project, earning cryptocurrency while helping other teams and realizing your own unique vision. Verus is all about community and collaboration, so we encourage users to support each other's projects!
What is the minimum number of public nodes required to start a chain?
The minimum number of public nodes required to start a chain is 2. You need to provide two public nodes to start your chain.

5 – Finish the create form (Steps 5 – 6)
After you’ve finished specifying your chain to your needs, you’ll need to provide it with two public nodes (that are going to run your chain) to start on. Setup your own first public nodes, or, ask the helpful community on the Verus discord to help you bootstrap your chain and give you some addresses to use. This step will be automated soon, but for now, you’ll need to provide initial nodes manually.
After you’ve sorted that out, review your chain data, and press “confirm” when you’re ready!
If a little green window pops up in the corner of your screen, congratulations! You’ve started a chain! Otherwise, you’ll get a little error message telling you what’s wrong.

Once the transaction that created your chain gets one confirmation (you can see this on your transactions screen), everyone connected to the test-net will be able to see your chain on the discover page, or search for it on the connect page, and connect to it!
You’ve just launched a secure, zk-SNARK and smart transaction supporting, 51% hash attack resistant, publicly mineable and stakeable blockchain in 5 simple steps, on a decentralized platform, without requiring or relying on any centralized entity. What’s even better is that you can mine and stake your own project and use the same hash power to mine and stake up to 14 other coins, earning cryptocurrency while helping other teams and realizing your own unique vision!
